title: What is payment switch and payment gateway? - Quora

response.answer_text: As I see it, payment switch and payment gateway are interchangeable terms. Judging from my experience, the term payment switch is often associated with legacy systems. Basically, a payment gateway is an intermediary entity, which authorizes data and facilitates data transfer between a payment portal and a front-end payment processor or acquiring bank. One of its main functions is to harmonize payment data formats. Traditionally, “payment gateway” term was used to define a more clear and simple instrument for e-commerce, while “payment switch” was associated with legacy technologies and systems. Today, the concepts got intermingled, because there are many gateways, that support multiple geographies, platforms, and payment types (including e-commerce, EMV cards etc). If the question arises in the context of integration with some platform. If your business plans such an integration and the platform provider sais that you need to be integrated with a payment switch or a payment gateway. Usually, integration with a payment switch (that is based on a legacy technology) might be more costly and time-consuming than the integration with a payment gateway. Here is an article on the subject that might prove useful: Payment Gateways: Integration Process - Paylosophy. Payment Switch is Transaction processing software which receives transaction request from more than one interface ( ATM, POS , mPOS, payment gateway and many more) and obtain authorisation for transaction from defined hosts ( Banking hosts for account authorisation for debit cards or credit card hosts or prepaid card host). Payment gateway is interface to e-commerce or online payments for online e-commerce purchase (for e.g. Amazon purchase using credit card). It validates transaction data and sends to as in our example from Amazon as merchant web site to the Credit card network for transaction authorisation. Once positive authorisation is obtained merchant proceeds with shipment.
